org.jemmy.fx

Class SceneWrap<T extends javafx.scene.Scene>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jemmy.control.Wrap<javafx.scene.Scene>
      • org.jemmy.fx.SceneWrap<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jemmy.control.ScreenArea, org.jemmy.interfaces.KeyTarget, org.jemmy.interfaces.MouseTarget

    @ControlType(value=javafx.scene.Scene.class)
@ControlInterfaces(value={org.jemmy.interfaces.Parent.class,org.jemmy.interfaces.Showable.class},
                   encapsulates=javafx.scene.Node.class)
@DockInfo(generateSubtypeLookups=true)
public class SceneWrap<T extends javafx.scene.Scene>
extends org.jemmy.control.Wrap<javafx.scene.Scene>
    Support for Java FX scene. A scene could be found within top-level hierarchy represented by Root class, using standard lookup approaches such as by a title, or by implementing a custom lookup criteria. Besides that a scene could be brought to front.
    You could find more on lookup in a lookup sample
    Author:
    shura
    See Also:
    Root, SceneDock

public static <CONTROL extends javafx.scene.Scene> org.jemmy.interfaces.Parent<? super javafx.scene.Scene> getRoot(java.lang.Class<CONTROL> controlType)
        This returns a parent which would be used for scene lookup when no other parent specified, which is, basically, always.
